qas.question: How are passenger cabs separated from the lift?
What type of vehicles are the passenger cabs?
What action do the cabs take before the elevator begins to move?

answers.text: move into the vertical motion shaft and lock themselves in

qas.question: What is special about the doorways of the top floors?

answers.text: The doorways of the top few "floors" of the attraction are open to the outdoor environment

qas.question: What does this allow riders to do at the top?

answers.text: look out from the top of the structure

context: The passenger cabs are <a0_0>mechanically<a0_0/> separated from the lift mechanism, thus allowing the elevator shafts to be used continuously while passengers board and embark from the cabs, as well as move through show scenes on various floors. The passenger cabs, which are <a1_0>automated guided vehicles or AGVs<a1_0/>, <a2_0>move into the vertical motion shaft and lock themselves in<a2_0/> before the elevator starts moving vertically. Multiple elevator shafts are used to further improve passenger throughput. <a3_0>The doorways of the top few "floors" of the attraction are open to the outdoor environment<a3_0/>, thus allowing passengers to <a4_0>look out from the top of the structure<a4_0/>.
